subject: Ice Dancing
lead_paragraph: Meryl Davis and Charlie White won the ice dancing title at the I.S.U. Four Continents competition in Vancouver, British Columbia. Davis and White, from suburban Detroit, scored a 192.39 to beat Canada’s Tessa Virtue and Scott Moir in the test event for the 2010 Olympics — the final one before next month’s world championships. Virtue and Moir, who led after Thursday’s original dance program, thrilled the fans with their innovative free dance program to Pink Floyd’s “The Great Gig in the Sky” and “Money,” scoring 191.81. The Americans Emily Samuelson and Evan Bates, from Ann Arbor, Mich., won the bronze with 180.69.
